subject: Re: [junit] question regarding setup()
msgSnippet: ... By default, the setup() and teardown() methods are called before and after each individual test method within the class. If you want a setup() to run once
messageBody:
On Wed, 21 Feb 2001, Ryan Ankarberg wrote:

> I was noticing that each time a particular test method within my test cases
> is called, it in turn calls setup(), each time... How can I go about having
> it only call setup() once, when the test case is initialized?

By default, the setup() and teardown() methods are called before and after
each individual test method within the class.

If you want a setup() to run once before any of the class test methods,
and a teardown() to run once after all of the class test methods, then
look at junit.extensions.TestSetup.java.

I've included an example of how I used it. An 'MP' in this context
is a native process which must be running for some of the tests.
It must contain a predefined, known set of user accounts which
the test case will be manipulating.

The TestSetup decorator calls a script in its setup() method
which creates the expected accounts, and the teardown() method
calls another script which removes the accounts and returns the
native process to a known state.

package com.aravox.nsapi;

import junit.extensions.TestSetup;
import junit.framework.Test;
import java.io.IOException;

/**
* Title: Test NSApi
* Description: Unit tests for NSApi
* Copyright: Copyright (c) 2000Joi Ellis
* Company: Aravox Technologies, Inc.
* @author Joi Ellis
* @version 1.0
*/

public class MPSetup extends TestSetup {

public MPSetup( Test t) {
super(t);
}
protected void setUp() {
try {
Runtime.getRuntime().exec("/home/joi/jbproject/TestNSApi/setupTestUsers");
} catch (IOException ioex) {
ioex.printStackTrace();
}
}
protected void tearDown() {
try {
Runtime.getRuntime().exec("/home/joi/jbproject/TestNSApi/removeTestUsers");
} catch (IOException ioex) {
ioex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}

To use MPSetup, I wrap my existing suite object inside a new
MPSetup suite like this:

public class AllTests extends TestCase {
....
public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(com.aravox.nsapi.TestConnectionInfo.suite());
suite.addTest(TestUdpConnect.suite());
suite.addTest(TestFirewall.suite());
suite.addTest(TestJNsApiSubsystemInterfaces.suite());
suite.addTest(TestNsConvertStringToMD5Secret.suite());
suite.addTest(TestNsConvertStringToSHA1Secret.suite());
suite.addTest(TestLocales.suite());
suite.addTest(TestResBundle.suite());
// now wrap my suite inside a MPSetup suite and return it.
MPSetup mps = new MPSetup( suite );
return mps;
}
....
}
